The claim is based on a Facebook post th: which has been viewed more than 35,000 times since July 24, 2019.
The post: s caption claims that the Federal Board of Revenue (FBR) has instructed the Sindh provincial government to raise taxes on motorcycles and rickshaws.
The video: s Urdu-language voiceover translates to English as: "For the registration of a 150,000 rupees rickshaw, 18,400 rupees will have to be paid as tax. The federal government has written a letter to the Sindh government to impose this tax."
The FBR: Pakistan's tax authority, has issued a statement refuting the claim, stating that no new tax has been introduced on vehicles and there are no plans to do so.
